edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.simulation

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.simulation.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    The simulator class handles procession of carts leaving the store and entering the registers
    Author:
    Islahuddin Arshad

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator(int numRegisters, int numCarts)
      The simulator takes in the number of registers and carts to check their bounds (not less than three or greater than twelve or if the carts are less than one) and creates the register objects

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double averageProcessTime()
      The average process time of the current cart is returned
      double averageWaitTime()
      The average wait time of the current cart is returned
      java.awt.Color getCurrentCartColor()
      Gets the current color of the cart being processed but returns null if the current cart is null
      int getCurrentIndex()
      Gets the current index of the cart being processed else returns -1
      int getStepsTaken()
      Get the number of steps taken by the simulator
      boolean itemLeftSimulation()
      Returns true if the most recently handled cart completed checking out and left a register line; Returns false if the most recently handled cart left the shopping area to enter a register line or if there is no current cart (null).
      boolean moreSteps()
      If the number of carts are fully processed or not True if the simulation has not yet finished, false if it has.
      static java.awt.Color[] simulationColors()
      Gets the simulation colors for each of the three carts
      static java.lang.String[] simulationLabels()
      Gets the simulation labels for each of the three carts
      void step()
      Increments the steps in the simulator when the event calender is updated.
      int totalNumberOfSteps()
      The total number of steps taken are twice the number of carts because for each cart, it is removed from the shopping area and after processing, removed from the simulation

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int numRegisters,
                 int numCarts)
        The simulator takes in the number of registers and carts to check their bounds (not less than three or greater than twelve or if the carts are less than one) and creates the register objects
        Parameters:
        numRegisters - the number of registers in the simulator will have to look through to process each cart in
        numCarts - The number of carts the simulator has to look to process
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - it is thrown if wrong number of register and if number of carts are less than one

    • Method Detail

      • simulationColors

        public static java.awt.Color[] simulationColors()
        Gets the simulation colors for each of the three carts
        Returns:
        Color the color of the carts

      • simulationLabels

        public static java.lang.String[] simulationLabels()
        Gets the simulation labels for each of the three carts
        Returns:
        String[] the label of the carts

      • step

        public void step()
        Increments the steps in the simulator when the event calender is updated. If that is the case, the current cart is "stepped" or processed by the simulator

      • getStepsTaken

        public int getStepsTaken()
        Get the number of steps taken by the simulator
        Returns:
        int the number of steps taken

      • totalNumberOfSteps

        public int totalNumberOfSteps()
        The total number of steps taken are twice the number of carts because for each cart, it is removed from the shopping area and after processing, removed from the simulation
        Returns:
        int the number of steps taken to process the carts

      • moreSteps

        public boolean moreSteps()
        If the number of carts are fully processed or not True if the simulation has not yet finished, false if it has.
        Returns:
        boolean whether more steps are required to go through a simulation

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Gets the current index of the cart being processed else returns -1
        Returns:
        int returns the current index else returns -1

      • getCurrentCartColor

        public java.awt.Color getCurrentCartColor()
        Gets the current color of the cart being processed but returns null if the current cart is null
        Returns:
        Color the color the current cart

      • itemLeftSimulation

        public boolean itemLeftSimulation()
        Returns true if the most recently handled cart completed checking out and left a register line; Returns false if the most recently handled cart left the shopping area to enter a register line or if there is no current cart (null).
        Returns:
        whether the current cart still remains in the simulation for the simulator to process

      • averageWaitTime

        public double averageWaitTime()
        The average wait time of the current cart is returned
        Returns:
        double the average wait time of the cart

      • averageProcessTime

        public double averageProcessTime()
        The average process time of the current cart is returned
        Returns:
        double the process wait time of the cart
